DAGUERREO : MATHEMATICS NOTES

  Index     About  

About This Site

Hello and welcome to Daguerreo, my archive of mathematics notes from my university study. “Daguerreotype” refers to an early photography process from the 1800s, which would be a pretty cool thing to name a website after – however, this site is actually named after a location from the video game Final Fantasy IX. My name is David; you can find out more about me by visiting my personal website via the “Home” link above.

My intent is for this site to eventually serve as a full archive of everything I learned during my studies. However, rewriting and uploading years worth of material is a slow process and is currently not my highest priority, so expect updates to be sporadic and some categories to be empty for a while yet.

Daguerreo was built using Jekyll and is hosted (for now) on Github Pages. Equations and another mathematical text are displayed using MathJax. The site’s current barebones layout is temporary, and will be replaced with something shinier when I have the time.
